tit.cmt: 以下天皇名、人名の読み方は、ブリタニカ国際大百科事典、広辞苑、kotobank.jpで確認。

sen.j: 陽成天皇（ようぜいてんのう、貞観10年12月16日(869年1月2日) - 天暦3年9月29日(949年10月23日)、在位：貞観18年（876年）11月29日 - 元慶8年（884年）2月4日)は第57代天皇。
sen.e: Emperor Yozei (January 2nd, 869 - October 23rd, 949), his reign was 876 - 884, who was the 57th Emperor.
Emperor Yozei (January 2, 869 - October 23, 949), his reign was 876 - 884, who was the fifty-seventh Emperor.
Emperor Yozei (January 2, 869 - October 23, 949), the fifty-seventh Emperor, reigned from November 29, 876 to February 4, 884.
sen.cmt: 日付補足from to 補足

sen.j: 諱は貞明（さだあきら）。
sen.e: His posthumous name was Sadaakira.
His posthumous name was Sadaakira.
His posthumous name was Sadaakira.

sen.j: 系譜
sen.e: Genealogy
Genealogy
Genealogy

sen.j: 第56代清和天皇の第一皇子。
sen.e: He was the first Prince of 56th Emperor SEIWA.
He was the first prince of Seiwa, the fifty-sixth Emperor.
He was the first prince of Seiwa, the fifty-sixth Emperor.

sen.j: 母は権中納言藤原長良〔ふじわらのながら〕の娘、女御藤原高子（二条后）。
sen.e: Mother was Gon-chunagon, FUJIWARA no Nagara's daughter, a high-ranking lady in the court(a wife of an emperor), FUJIWARA no Takaiko. (Nijo no kisaki)
sen.cmt: 権中納言 定訳不明
sen.e: Mother was Gon-chunagon, FUJIWARA no Nagara's daughter, a high-ranking lady in the court(a wife of an emperor), FUJIWARA no Takaiko. (Nijo no kisaki)
His mother was Gon-chunagon, FUJIWARA no Nagara's daughter, a high-ranking lady in the court (the wife of an Emperor), FUJIWARA no Takaiko (Nijo no kisaki).
sen.cmt: スペース挿入ピリオドの位置移動

sen.j: 子に歌人として優れた元良親王と元平親王らがいる。
sen.e: Prince Motoyoshi and Prince Motohira are his children who are talented poets.
Prince Motoyoshi and Prince Motohira, both talented poets, were his children.
Prince Motoyoshi and Prince Motohira, both talented poets, were his children.

sen.j: 元平親王は陽成源氏の祖であるが、のちに武家の棟梁となる清和源氏は実際は陽成源氏で、この元平親王を先祖とするが、後述するとおり陽成帝には暴君との評判があり、それを嫌って一代前の清和天皇に祖を求めたのだとの説が近年提示されている。
sen.e: Prince Motoyoshi is the earliest ancestor of YOZEI GENJI clan, and also the earliest ancestor of SEIWA GENJI clan originated in YOZEI GENJI clan, who act as head of the military caste (the warrior class) in future, in recent years it is said however Emperor YOZEI is known as a dictator as mentioned later, thus the origin of SEIWA GENJI is said to not to be in YOZEI GEIJI.

Prince Motoyoshi is the earliest ancestor of the YOZEI GENJI clan and also the earliest ancestor of SEIWA GENJI clan (which originated in the YOZEI GENJI clan), which would eventually act as head of the military caste (the warrior class); however, in recent years it has been said that Emperor Yozei was known as a dictator (as mentioned later), so the origin of SEIWA GENJI is said to not to be in YOZEI GEIJI.

Prince Motohira was the earliest ancestor of the Yozei-Genji (Minamoto clan) and the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan) (which originated in the Yozei-Genji (Minamoto clan)), which would eventually act as head of the military caste (the warrior class); however, in recent years it has been said that Emperor Yozei was known as a dictator (as mentioned later), so the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan) disliked him and wanted to have Emperor Seiwa as an ancestor.
sen.cmt: Motoyoshi→MotohiraYOZEI GENJI→Yozei GenjiSEIWA GENJI→Seiwa Genji「それを嫌って一代前の清和天皇に祖を求めた」の部分の訳修正"Yozei Genji clan"→"Yozei-Genji (Minamoto clan)"に変更しました。"Seiwa Genji clan"→"Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)"に変更しました。

sen.j: 略歴
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Brief Personal History
sen.cmt: Biography→Brief Personal Historyに変更しました。

sen.j: 生後2ヶ月足らずで立太子。
sen.e: He became Crown Prince when he was two months old.
He became the crown prince at the age of two months.
He became the crown prince at the age of two months.

sen.j: 9歳で清和天皇から譲位され帝位に就く。
sen.e: He succeeded to the Imperial Throne at the age of nine after Emperor SEIWA abdicated and passed the position to him.
He succeeded to the Imperial Throne at the age of nine after Emperor SEIWA abdicated and passed the position to him.
He succeeded to the Imperial Throne at the age of nine after Emperor Seiwa abdicated and passed the position to him.

sen.j: 在位の初めは父上皇、母高子、摂政藤原基経（天皇の伯父）が協力して政務を見た。
sen.e: During the early stage of the enthronement, his father, the ex-Emperor, his mother, Takako and the Regent FUJIWARA no Mototsune (Emperor's uncle) all helped to rule the government.
During the early stage of the enthronement his father, the ex-emperor, his mother Takako and the Regent FUJIWARA no Mototsune (the Emperor's uncle) all helped to rule the government.
During the early stage of the enthronement his father, the Retired Emperor, his mother Takako and the Regent FUJIWARA no Mototsune (the Emperor's uncle) all helped to rule the government.

sen.j: 父清和上皇の死後、基経との関係が悪化したらしく、基経は出仕をボイコットするに及ぶ。
sen.e: After his father Emperor SEIWA died, the relationship between Emperor YOZEI and Mototsune got worse, Mototsune once refused to serve the government.
Following the death of his father, Emperor Seiwa, the relationship between Emperor Yozei and Mototsune became worse, and Mototsune once refused to serve the government.
Following the death of his father, Emperor Seiwa, the relationship between Emperor Yozei and Mototsune became worse, and Mototsune once refused to serve the government.

sen.j: 清和天皇に二人の娘を入内させたのに続き、陽成天皇の元服に際し、さらに娘の藤原佳美子または藤原温子を入内させようとしたのを、母后の高子が拒否したためではないかというのが、近年の説である。
sen.e: There is a recent theory for above situation, Mototsune sent his two daughters for them to become Emperor SEIWA's lady, followed by sending his another daughter, either FUJIWARA no Kamiko or FUJIWARA no Onshito to Emperor SEIWA when Emperor YOZEI had coming-of-age ceremony, however the Empress might have refused to have them.

There is a recent theory regarding the above situation, which asserts that Mototsune sent his two daughters for them to become Emperor Seiwa's ladies, followed by sending another daughter, either FUJIWARA no Kamiko or FUJIWARA no Onshito, to Emperor Seiwa when Emperor Yozei had his coming-of-age ceremony; however, the Empress might have refused to have them.

There is a recent theory regarding the above situation, which asserts that Mototsune sent his two daughters to become Emperor Seiwa's ladies, followed by sending another daughter, either FUJIWARA no Kamiko or FUJIWARA no Onshito, to Emperor Seiwa when Emperor Yozei had his coming-of-age ceremony; however, the Empress might have refused to have them.

sen.j: 陽成天皇は乱れた行いが多いとされてきた。
sen.e: Emperor YOZEI is known that he did not have good disciplines.
Emperor Yozei was known for his lack of self-discipline.
Emperor Yozei was known for his lack of self-discipline.

sen.j: 元慶7年（883年）には宮中で自身の乳母であった紀全子（きのまたこ）の子、源益（みなもとのすすむ）を殴殺する事件を起こし、譲位を余儀なくされる。
sen.e: In 883, Emperor YOZEI beat MINAMOTO no Susumu, his nanny, KI no Matako's son, to death and was forced to abdicate from the throne.
In 883, Emperor Yozei beat MINAMOTO no Susumu, the son of his nanny, KI no Matako, to death and was forced to abdicate the throne.
In 883, Emperor Yozei beat MINAMOTO no Susumu, the son of his wet nurse, KI no Matako, to death and was forced to abdicate the throne.

sen.j: 基経によって退位に追い込まれたという。
sen.e: It is said Mototsune forced him to do so.
It is said that Mototsune forced him to do so.
It is said that Mototsune forced him to do so.

sen.j: ただし、陽成天皇の暴君説は退位時の年齢が17歳（満15歳）であり疑問点も多く、天皇を廃位し、自身の意向に沿う光孝天皇・宇多天皇帝を擁立した基経の罪を抹消するための作為だともいわれる。
sen.e: Although Emperor YOZEI is infamous for his bad behavior, it is questioned whether it is true story or not as he was only seventeen years old when abdicated, it could have been Mototsune's artifact to cover up his accusation to remove Emperor YOZEI from his position and set up his favorite Emperor, Emperor KOKO and Emperor UDA to succeed the throne.

Although Emperor Yozei is infamous for his bad behavior, it is questioned whether the story could be true, since he was only 17 years old at the time of his abdication; it could have been Mototsune's attempt to cover up his accusation in order to remove Emperor Yozei from his position and set up his favorites (the future emperors Koko and Uda) to succeed the throne.

Although Emperor Yozei is infamous for his bad behavior, it is questioned whether the story could be true, since he was only 17 years old at the time of his abdication; it could have been Mototsune's attempt to cover up his accusation in order to remove Emperor Yozei from his position and set up his favorites (the future emperors Koko and Uda) to succeed the throne.

sen.j: また、退位後も光孝・宇多・醍醐天皇の諸帝の警戒感は強く、『日本三代実録』や『新国史』の編纂は陽成上皇に対して自己の皇統の正当性を主張するための史書作成であったとする説がある。
sen.e: Even after Emperor YOZEI abdicated, Emperor KOKO, Emperor UDA and Emperor DAIGO are all suspicious about the situation, some people said the historical books like "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" and "Shin Kokushi" were edited to prove the line of those Emperor's justice to go against Emperor YOZEI.

Even after Emperor Yozei abdicated, the emperors Koko, Uda and Daigo were all suspicious about the situation; some people have said that historical books such as "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" and "Shin Kokushi" were edited to prove the justice of those emperors in going against Emperor Yozei.

Even after Emperor Yozei abdicated, the emperors Koko, Uda and Daigo were all suspicious about the situation; some people have said that historical books such as "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" and "Shin Kokushi" were edited to prove the justice of those emperors in going against Retired Emperor Yozei.
sen.cmt: "Emperor Yozei"→"Retired Emperor Yozei"に変更しました。

sen.j: 退位後に幾度か歌合せを催すなど、歌才があったようだが、自身の歌として伝わるのは後撰和歌集に入撰し、のちに小倉百人一首にも採録された下記一首のみである。
sen.e: Emperor YOZEI was supposed have some talent in making poems and he organized a tanka matching; a tanka (writing) contest by himself for sometimes, there is only one following song made by the Emperor, which he won a prize from Gosen Wakashu (Later Collection of Japanese Poetry) and later recorded in One hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets.

Emperor Yozei was supposed have some poetic talent, and on various occasions he organized tanka matches (tanka (writing) contests) by himself; there is only one following song made by the Emperor, which won a prize from Gosen Wakashu (Later Collection of Japanese Poetry) and was later recorded in (A Hundred Poems by a Hundred Poets."

Emperor Yozei was supposed to have some poetic talent, and on various occasions he organized tanka matches (tanka (writing) contests) by himself; there is only one existing song made by the Emperor, which won a prize from Gosen Wakashu (Later Collection of Japanese Poetry) and was later recorded in (A Hundred Poems by a Hundred Poets).
sen.cmt: to補足スペース削除"削除し)追加

sen.j: 「つくばねの峰よりおつるみなの川 恋ぞつもりて淵となりける」 （百人一首では「淵となりぬる」）
sen.e: The small stream of Minano-gawa river coming from Tsukuba falls into another stream, and gradually become oblivion, when I think of someone I love, my feeling is same like Minano-gawa river, it seems to get deeper and deeper.' (In One hundred Poems, it is said 'En to nari nuru' (instead of nari keru)

The little stream of the Minano-gawa river coming from Tsukuba falls into another stream, and gradually entering oblivion; when I think of someone I love, my feeling is same as the Minano-gawa River; it seems to get deeper and deeper' (in "A hundred Poems" it is given as 'en to nari nuru' (instead of nari keru).

The little stream of the Minano-gawa river coming from Tsukuba falls into another stream, and gradually enters oblivion; when I think of someone I love, my feeling is same as the Minano-gawa River; it seems to get deeper and deeper' (in "A Hundred Poems" it is given as 'en to nari nuru' (instead of nari keru).

sen.j: 上皇歴65年は2位の冷泉天皇の42年を大きく凌ぐ1位である。
sen.e: He spent sixty five years as an ex-Emperor and it is longest period in the history, followed by Emperor REIZEI who spent forty two years as an ex-Emperor.
He spent 65 years as an ex-emperor--the longest span in history--a record followed by Emperor Reizei, who spent 42 years as an ex-emperor.
He spent 65 years as an Retired Emperor--the longest span in history--a record followed by Emperor Reizei, who spent 42 years as an Retired Emperor.

sen.j: 『大鏡』には、いったん臣籍降下したにもかかわらず、父、光孝天皇の後をうけ即位した元侍従であった宇多天皇のことを、「あれはかつて私に仕えていた者ではないか」と言ったという逸話が残っている。
sen.e: According to "O-kagami (The Great Mirror)", in spite of ex-Emperor YOZA's demotion from nobility to subject, when seeing Emperor UDA who used to be Palace staff and enthroned after ex-Emperor's father, Emperor KOKO abdicated, it is said the ex-Emperor mentioned, 'That person used to serve me at the Palace, did'nt he?'

According to "O-kagami (The Great Mirror)," despite ex-Emperor Yozei's demotion from nobility to subject, when seeing Emperor Uda, who used to be one of the palace staff and was enthroned after the abdication of the ex-emperor's father, Emperor Koko, it is said that the ex-emperor asked, 'That person used to serve me at the palace, didn't he?'

According to "O-kagami (The Great Mirror)," despite Retired Emperor Yozei's demotion from nobility to subject, when seeing Emperor Uda, who used to be one of the palace staff and was enthroned after the abdication of the Retired Emperor's father, Emperor Koko, it is said that the Retired Emperor asked, 'That person used to serve me at the palace, didn't he?'
sen.cmt: "ex-Emperor Yozei"→"the Retired Emperor Yozei"に変更しました。"ex-emperor"→"Retired Emperor"に変更しました。

sen.j: その皇子で又従兄弟でもあった敦仁親王（醍醐天皇）よりも長生きし、更に朱雀天皇、村上天皇と、大叔父の光孝系の皇統継承を見届けたのもまた、皮肉な事であった。
sen.e: It is ironic that ex-Emperor YOZEI lived longer than Emperor UDA's Prince and cousin, Prince Atsugimi/Atsuhito (Emperor DAIGO), also he had to experience Imperial succession of Emperor Suzaku, Emperor Murakami and his granduncle who is on Emperor KOKO side.

It is ironic that ex-Emperor Yozei lived longer than Emperor Uda's prince and cousin, Prince Atsugimi (Atsuhito) (Emperor Daigo); moreover, he had to experience the imperial succession of Emperor Suzaku, Emperor Murakami and his great uncle on Emperor Koko's side.

It is ironic that the Retired Emperor Yozei lived longer than Emperor Uda's prince and cousin, Prince Atsugimi (Atsuhito) (Emperor Daigo); moreover, he had to experience the imperial succession of Emperor Suzaku, Emperor Murakami and his great uncle on Emperor Koko's side.
sen.cmt: "ex-Emperor Yozei"→"the Retired Emperor Yozei"に変更しました。

sen.j: ちなみに唯一現代まで伝わる上記の歌は宇多天皇の妹にあたる妃の一人、釣殿宮綏子内親王にあてた歌である。
sen.e: Above is the only song handed down to recent years, this song was made for one of ex-Emperor's wife, Princess Tsuridono no miya Suishi, who was Emperor UDA's sister.
Above is the only song handed down to the present day, having been made for one of the ex-emperor's wives, Princess Tsuridono no miya Suishi, who was Emperor Uda's sister.
Above is the only song handed down to the present day, having been made for one of the Retired Emperor's wives, Princess Tsuridono no miya Suishi, who was Emperor Uda's sister.

sen.j: 在位中の元号
sen.e: Eras during his reign
Eras during his reign
Eras during his reign

sen.j: 貞観
sen.e: Jogan
Jogan
Jogan

sen.j: 元慶
sen.e: Gangyo (Gankyo)
Gangyo (Gankyo)
Gangyo (Gankyo)

sen.j: 陵墓・霊廟
sen.e: Imperial mausoleum
The Imperial Mausoleum
The Imperial Mausoleum

sen.j: 京都市左京区浄土寺真如町にある神楽岡東陵（かぐらおかのひがしのみささぎ）に葬られた。
sen.e: The Emperor was entombed in Kaguraoka no higashi no Misasagi in Shinnyo-cho Town, Jodoji, Sakyo Ward. Kyoto City.
The Emperor was entombed in Kaguraoka no higashi no Misasagi in Shinnyo-cho Town, Jodoji, in the Sakyo ward of Kyoto City.
The Emperor was entombed in Kaguraoka no higashi no Misasagi in Shinnyo-cho Town, Jodoji, in the Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City.
